captions.text: Let me sail, let me sail, let the Orinoco Flow,
let me reach, let me beach on the shores of Tripoli.
Let me sail, let me sail, let me crash upon your shore,
let me reach, let me beach, far beyond the Yellow Sea.
Sail away, sail away, sail away.
From Bissau to Palau, in the shade of Avalon,
from Fiji to Tiree, and the Isles of Ebony
from Peru to Cebu, hear the power of Babylon,
from Bali to Cali - far beneath the Coral Sea.
Turn it up, turn it up, turn it up, up, adieu. Aah...
Sail away, sail away, sail away.
From the North to the South, Ebudæ into Khartoum,
from the deep sea of Clouds to the island of the moon,
carry me on the waves, to the lands I've never been,
carry me on the waves, to the lands I've never seen!
We can sail, we can sail, with the Orinoco Flow,
we can sail, we can sail.
(sail away, sail away, sail away)
We can steer, we can near,
with Rob Dickins at the wheel,
we can sigh, say goodbye, Ross and his dependencies,
we can sail, we can sail...
sail away, sail away, sail away
We can reach, we can beach,
on the shores of Tripoli,
we can sail, we can sail
sail away, sail away, sail away
From Bali to Cali - far beneath the Coral Sea,
From Bissau to Palau - in the shade of Avalon,
We can reach, we can beach,
far beyond the Yellow Sea,
From Peru to Cebu, hear the power of Babylon...
We can sail, we can sail!
Sail away, sail away, sail away...!

comments.text:
Such a Beautiful song! If you have ever sailed before, and if you close 
your eyes and listen to this song, you can escape to many beautiful places 
in the world. You can smell the sea in the air and feel the wind and ocean 
spray on your face, I have always loved this song. My late brother was a 
composer of film music and he loved to sail. This sounds like a song he 
would write.

comments.text:
This has been noted before in the comments, along the nearly 7 years this 
vid has been up. As I've explained, the missing 3 seconds are after the 
final fade out, which I didn't notice at the time and for which I 
apologize. I will not redo the vid to fix that, so if you're interested in 
the FULL song, message me with your e-mail addy and I will be glad to send 
you the FULL UNCUT file. Thank you.

comments.text:
"Orinoco Flow" is the song's original name, this vid I named "Sail Away". 
"The song is often incorrectly referred to as "Sail Away", a phrase 
repeated during the chorus; although, in the United States, the song was 
actually retitled, "Orinoco Flow (Sail Away)". Released as the lead single 
from Enya's second studio album, Watermark, in October 1988, the song 
became a "breakthrough" success for the singer-songwriter, whereby popular 
recognition was achieved on a global scale." - ref. Wikipedia
comments.author: chuckgary
